Hello!

I'm Nanditha, a design-minded architect focused on building elegant structures & experiences.

About me

I'm a final year undergraduate at the Indian Institute of Information Technology Pune majoring in Computer Science and Engineering, a programmer by passion and an open-source enthusiast, looking forward to contribute to the advancement of computer science. I, along with my team, had won the Smart India Hackathon 2019 edition for the problem statement "Inconsistency detection in medical annotations" under ezDI. During the summer internship in my sophomore year, I worked with Dr. K. Chandrasekaran at NIT Surathkal and published a research paper on "Data-Driven Stillbirth Prediction and Analysis of Risk Factors in Pregnancy". Recently, I've been developing web applications, exploring MERN stack, web sockets and cloud databases.
